The 'BTR-60' is the first vehicle in a series of Soviet eight-wheeled armoured
personnel carriers (APCs). It was developed in the late 1950s as a replacement
for the BTR-152 and was seen first time in public in 1961. BTR stands for
Bronetransporter (ÐÐ¢Ð , ÐÑÐ¾Ð½ÐµÑÑÐ°Ð½ÑÐ¿Ð¾ÑÑÐµÑ, literally "armoured transporter"). [http://web.archive.org/web/20061103033619/http://www.milparade.com/Soderzhani-
ye.pdf KAT-orygie-0/24-49-soderzanie]. Web.archive.org (3 November 2006).
Retrieved on 21 September 2011.
